alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 10:20AM MDT until April 22 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Saco affecting Phillips and Valley Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Saco. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water starts flooding the Bjornberg Bridge fishing access site on the north side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 20.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM MDT Wednesday was 21.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.5 feet on 06/09/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM MDT.
